text: A place where seniors like to shop for traditional festive dried n preserve food , which is on the ground floor. There is also a hidden gem food court that has yummy hot steam hand made dim sum, my fave crunchy roast pork n burnt char siew rice / noodles and the vegetarian galore dishes for vegans just to name a few. On the upper floors, one can find Chinese treasures of jadite n crystals. It also houses Thailand famous 4 Face Buddha on the first floor , where a monk offers daily blessings to worshippers. This place is an eye opener for those looking to discover something different, as many of the other stalls around building offer unusual products n services. Old charm days are what attract folks back here to hang out over cuppa of strong sweet local coffee n the toasted egg jam bread . Nostalgic n comfort food .

The basement has a coffee shop that sells a variety of Chinese and other Asian beers. Friendly and sweet older couple who run it together. It was a great place to try new beers while sitting down to plan my holiday in Singapore.

Good for amulets acesseries, casing service.
As well altar budda offer items.
Also crystals shop available and bracelets service at b1.
The worst fruit store in front of Fu Lu Shou Complex. Brought their chemically soaked longans, look fresh outside but all white color with mild bleach taste and smell. Do not buy from them!
Though it's a Friday afternoon, still very crowded with aunties due to lunar Feb where Buddhist enjoy a low cost vegetarian meal.
